goal.ch:
1.培養學生建立「藝術作品—藝術家—藝術理論與批評」之關係的整體認識，能夠比較不同的閱讀面向、立場及觀點，靈活地思考藝術文化的現象和議題。

2.培養學生初步建立針對當代藝術創作與視覺文化的評論寫作能力。
goal.en:
1. To develop students' overall understanding of the relationship between "artwork-artist-art theory and criticism" and to be able to compare different reading approaches, positions, and perspectives, to consider art and cultural phenomena and issues in a flexible manner.

2. To develop students' initial critical writing skills for contemporary art and visual culture.

outline.ch:
在一個人人皆能透過串流影音平台或社群媒體，對任何時事、文化現象發表評議的年代，是否掌握理論與批評的有效方法，其實決定了妳∕你的觀點是打不到痛點的無病呻吟，還是言之有理的硬實力。
本課程規劃的初衷，乃是將「理論的閱讀」與「批評的實踐」，視為一種大學生就可以配備的基本能力。換言之，本課程並不以艱澀難解的高階理論鑽研為目標。這是因為，所謂的「藝術理論」從來都不是拿來嚇唬人的虛偽面具，也不是華麗但空洞的詞藻堆砌；我們之所以需要理論，是因為它能夠讓我們多層次、多面向地解讀我們所在乎的那個世界的一切細節。其次，藝術理論也是我們據以拆除陳腐僵化的意識型態，並且大膽拋出嶄新觀點和價值的重要基礎。簡單地說，缺乏理論性的宏觀反思，只訴諸行動的藝術實踐將會是盲目的；我們甚至可以大膽地說，任何有意義、有方向性的藝術實踐，總是通過一番縝密的理論深思。
本課程旨在藉由藝術相關基礎概念的根源性回顧，以及現當代議題的深入探索，帶領修課同學解理論發想在整體藝術活動中的位置，並且嘗試活用之；在課程進行過程中，我們將會透過對時事案例的交叉討論，甚至是即席寫作的嘗試，培養同學們對於「理論之用」的實際體會。期望經過基礎概念與方法的掌握，使同學未來接觸更進階的課程之前，能對藝術的詮釋、批評，以及論辯，有更為全面的認識。
----
每週進度
第一週課程簡介
第一部分：基礎概念篇
第二週藝術定義的難題I、II
第三週藝術，一個概念史的梳理 I、II
第四週為「少數藝術」辯護：天上學的必要性 I、II
第五週意圖主義，與藝術作品的詮釋
第六週文化相對主義與社會定義論
第二部分：影像政治篇
第七週多重裂解年代的自我觀看
第八週影像的聖像破壞之力
第九週（過度）正向的美學感同
第十週紀實性與溫情主義
第三部份：身體政治篇
第十一週自我東方主義與「白化」爭議
第十二週挪用皮膚，佔奪身體
第十三週在黑暗之心攝影
第十四週殖民身體的凝視與回看
第四部份：時事爭議篇
第十五週藝術與人權的詭譎對峙（景美人權文化園區事件）
第十六週生命的展示及其減損（《我叫小黑》與動物展示爭議）
第十七週現實及其藝術複本（Mark Wallinger與藝術文件）
第十八週活彈藥與藝術的虛擬越界（《史蒂諾斯之夢遊美術館》事件）
outline.en:
The original purpose of this course is to consider "theoretical reading" and "critical practice" as basic abilities that can be acquired by university students. This course does not pursue the goal of advanced theoretical research that is incomprehensible and elusive. This is because so-called "art theory" has never been a hypocritical mask to bluff people, nor a fancy but empty pile of words; we need theory because it allows us to interpret all the details of the world we care about in a multi-layered way.
This course is designed to provide a review of basic art concepts and an in-depth exploration of contemporary issues. It will lead students to understand the position of theoretical thinking in the context of the art scene as a whole and to try to put it into practice. During these sessions, we will develop students' actual experience of the "use of theory" through cross discussion and improvised writing.
It is expected that through the mastery of basic concepts and methods, students will have a more comprehensive understanding of artistic interpretation, criticism, and argumentation before moving on to more advanced courses.
----
Weekly Schedule
Week 1 Course Introduction
Part I: Basic Concepts
Week 2: Difficulties in the Definition of Art I and II
Week 3: Art, a History of Concepts I, II
Week 4 In Defense of "Minority Art": The Necessity of Celestial Studies I, II
Week 5 Intentionalism and the Interpretation of Artworks
Week 6 Cultural Relativism and Social Justification
Part II: The Politics of Image
Week 7: Self-viewing in the Age of Multiple Fragmentations
Week 8: The Iconoclastic Forces of Images
Week 9 (Excessive) Positive Aesthetic Sympathy
Week 10: Documentality and Sentimentalism
Part 3: Body Politics
Week 11: Self-Orientalism and the "Whiteness" Debate
Week 12 Appropriation of Skin, Occupation of Body
Week 13: Photography in the Heart of Darkness
Week 14: Gazing and Looking Back at the Colonial Body
Part IV: Current Controversies
Week 15: The Strange Confrontation between Art and Human Rights
Week 16: The Presentation of Life and its Impairment
Week 17: Reality and its Artistic Reproduction
Week 18: Live Ammunition and the Virtual Transgression of Art
